connector.description: Expose HTTP and WebSocket endpoints and access external HTTP/WebSocket servers.

camel.sink.path.httpURI.name: camel.sink.path.httpURI
camel.sink.path.httpURI.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to use.

camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming
camel.sink.endpoint.useStreaming.description: For HTTP endpoint: if true, text and binary messages will be wrapped as java.io.InputStream before they are passed to an Exchange; otherwise they will be passed as byte. For WebSocket endpoint: if true, text and binary messages will be wrapped as java.io.Reader and java.io.InputStream respectively before they are passed to an Exchange; otherwise they will be passed as String and byte respectively.

camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.description: Configure a cookie handler to maintain a HTTP session

camel.sink.endpoint.keepAlive.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keepAlive
camel.sink.endpoint.keepAlive.description: Setting to ensure socket is not closed due to inactivity

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.options.name: camel.sink.endpoint.options
camel.sink.endpoint.options.description: Sets additional channel options. The options that can be used are defined in org.xnio.Options. To configure from endpoint uri, then prefix each option with option., such as option.close-abort=true&option.send-buffer=8192

camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHostHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHostHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHostHeader.description: If the option is true, UndertowProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header, useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client, this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service.

camel.sink.endpoint.tcpNoDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.tcpNoDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.tcpNoDelay.description: Setting to improve TCP protocol performance

camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.name: camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFailure
camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transferException
camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessLogReceiver.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessLogReceiver
camel.sink.endpoint.accessLogReceiver.description: Which Undertow AccessLogReceiver should be used Will use JBossLoggingAccessLogReceiver if not specified

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.sink.endpoint.undertowHttpBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.undertowHttpBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.undertowHttpBinding.description: To use a custom UndertowHttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and undertow.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowedRoles.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowedRoles
camel.sink.endpoint.allowedRoles.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Comma separated list of allowed roles.

camel.sink.endpoint.securityConfiguratio.name: camel.sink.endpoint.securityConfiguration
camel.sink.endpoint.securityConfiguratio.description: OConfiguration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Security configuration object for use from UndertowSecurityProvider. Configuration is UndertowSecurityProvider specific. Each provider decides whether accepts configuration.

camel.sink.endpoint.securityProvider.name: camel.sink.endpoint.securityProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.securityProvider.description: Security provider allows plug in the provider, which will be used to secure requests. SPI approach could be used too (endpoint then finds security provider using SPI).

camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds when sending to a websocket channel. The default timeout is 30000 (30 seconds).

camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll
camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure on endpoint level, instead of having to use the UndertowConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message.

camel.component.undertow.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.undertow.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.undertow.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.undertow.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.undertow.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.undertow.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.undertow.hostOptions.name: camel.component.undertow.hostOptions
camel.component.undertow.hostOptions.description: To configure common options, such as thread pools

camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBin.name: camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBinding
camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBin.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles.name: camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles
camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Comma separated list of allowed roles.

camel.component.undertow.securityConfigu.name: camel.component.undertow.securityConfiguration
camel.component.undertow.securityConfigu.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Security configuration object for use from UndertowSecurityProvider. Configuration is UndertowSecurityProvider specific. Each provider decides, whether it accepts configuration.

camel.component.undertow.securityProvide.name: camel.component.undertow.securityProvider
camel.component.undertow.securityProvide.description: Security provider allows plug in the provider, which will be used to secure requests. SPI approach could be used too (component then finds security provider using SPI).

camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslCon.name: camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslCon.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
